comments.creator: jgriffin@mozilla.com
comments.author: jgriffin@mozilla.com
comments.text:
As part of the BuildFaster project (see https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReleaseEngineering/BuildFaster), we are investigating whether certain slow mochitests can be sped up.

test_CrossSiteXHR_cache.html is a slow test, average execution time on a recent run (in ms):

	win32-debug, 34557
	linux-opt, 15714
	macosx64-debug, 38982
	win32-opt, 16027
	linux64-debug, 31666
	linux64-opt, 15537
	macosx-debug, 35145
	linux-debug, 33430
comments.raw_text:
As part of the BuildFaster project (see https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReleaseEngineering/BuildFaster), we are investigating whether certain slow mochitests can be sped up.

test_CrossSiteXHR_cache.html is a slow test, average execution time on a recent run (in ms):

	win32-debug, 34557
	linux-opt, 15714
	macosx64-debug, 38982
	win32-opt, 16027
	linux64-debug, 31666
	linux64-opt, 15537
	macosx-debug, 35145
	linux-debug, 33430

comments.creator: jgriffin@mozilla.com
comments.text: Jonas, as the original test author, would you be willing to help figure out if this test could be sped up?
comments.author: jgriffin@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: Jonas, as the original test author, would you be willing to help figure out if this test could be sped up?

comments.author: jonas@sicking.cc
comments.text:
We can easily cut out 6 seconds by changing all

cacheTime: 2
to
cacheTime: 1


and all
{ pause: 2.1 },
to
{ pause: 1.1 },


We could also probably parallelize the waiting to cut down another 5 seconds. But that requires more restructuring of the tests.

That still leaves a lot of time though. How much time is saved by removing the for-loop on line 422?
comments.creator: jonas@sicking.cc

comments.creator: jgriffin@mozilla.com
comments.author: jgriffin@mozilla.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #2)

> That still leaves a lot of time though. How much time is saved by removing
> the for-loop on line 422?

Removing this for loop saves 11 seconds on linux-debug.
